definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To satisfy (thirst, or other desires). [from 14 c.]
( transitive ) To cool (something) with water or another liquid. [from 14 c.]
( intransitive ) To become mixed with water, so that a true chemical combination takes place.
( transitive ) To mix with water, so that a true chemical combination takes place.
( intransitive , obsolete ) Of a person: to become less energetic , to slacken in one's efforts. [11 –17 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To slacken ; to become relaxed or loose . [11 –16 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To become less intense ; to weaken , decrease in force. [14 –19 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To go out ; to become extinct .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To satisfy (thirst, or other desires). [from 14 c.]

( intransitive ) To become mixed with water, so that a true chemical combination takes place.

( intransitive , obsolete ) Of a person: to become less energetic , to slacken in one's efforts. [11 –17 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To slacken ; to become relaxed or loose . [11 –16 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To become less intense ; to weaken , decrease in force. [14 –19 c.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) To go out ; to become extinct .
